page.title: 07HEADMASTER 4O+ WITH FAMILY
page.content: Lived in Portchester for seven and a half years. He considers his main problem in life to be a lessening of job satisfaction and he feels bitter about the state of the education system and the status of the teaching profession. One national problem is the philosophical division of the country. Ideas of separate people and parties conflict so greatly that no common ground or compromise can be found between the extremes eg Nationalisation by Labour or Denationalisation by the Conservatives Here, political dogma dictates the course taken instead of economic commonsense.
